{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI) is a scale used to determine the severity of sleep apnea. It measures the number of apnea (pauses in breathing) or hypopnea (shallow breaths) events per hour of sleep. According to the American Academy of Sleep Medicine, an AHI of 5-15 is considered mild sleep apnea.", "answer_choice": "A. >5"}
